name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: [SOUND] This lecture is about

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: the Text-Based Prediction.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _In this lecture
column6: we're going to start talking about the mining _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _a different kind of knowledge
column6: as you can see here on this slide. _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: Namely we're going to use text data to infer values of some other

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: variables in the real world that may not be directly related to the text.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: Or only remotely related to text data.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: So this is very different from content analysis or

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: topic mining where we directly characterize the content of text.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _It's also different from opinion mining or sentiment analysis

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: which still have to do is characterizing mostly the content.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: Only that we focus more on the subject of content

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: which reflects what we know about the opinion holder.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: But this only provides limited review of what we can predict.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _In this lecture and the following lectures
column6: we're going to talk more about _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: how we can predict more Information about the world.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: How can we get the sophisticated patterns of text together with other kind of data?

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _It would be useful first to take a look at the big picture of prediction

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _data mining in general
column6: and I call this data mining loop. _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _So the picture that you are seeing right now is that there are multiple sensors

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _including human sensors

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: to report what we have seen in the real world in the form of data.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _Of course the data in the form of non-text data

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And our goal is to see if we can predict some values of

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: important real world variables that matter to us.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _For example

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And so these variables would be important because we might want to act on that.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: We might want to make decisions based on that.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: So how can we get from the data to these predicted values?

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: Well in general we'll first have to do data mining and analysis of the data.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _Because we
column7: should treat all the data that we collected _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: in such a prediction problem set up.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: We are very much interested in joint mining of non-text and

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _text data
column6: which should combine all the data together. _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _And then

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: are multiple predictors of this interesting variable to us.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And we call these features.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _And these features can then be put into a predictive model

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: to actually predict the value of any interesting variable.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: So this then allows us to change the world.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And so this basically is the general process for

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _making a prediction based on data

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: Now it's important to emphasize that a human actually

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: plays a very important role in this process.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: Especially because of the involvement of text data.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: So human first would be involved in the mining of the data.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: It would control the generation of these features.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _And it would also help us understand the text data

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: because text data are created to be consumed by humans.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: Humans are the best in consuming or interpreting text data.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _But when there are
column7: a lot of text data then machines have to help and _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: that's why we need to do text data mining.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: Sometimes machines can see patterns in a lot of data that humans may not see.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: But in general human would play an important role in

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _analyzing some text data

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _Next
column6: human also must be involved in predictive model building and _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: adjusting or testing.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _So in particular
column6: we will have a lot of domain knowledge about the problem _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: of prediction that we can build into this predictive model.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _And then next
column7: when we have predictive values for the variables

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: then humans would be involved in taking actions to change a word or

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: make decisions based on these particular values.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And finally it's interesting that a human could be involved

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: in controlling the sensors.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And this is so that we can adjust to the sensors to collect

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: the most useful data for prediction.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: So that's why I call this data mining loop.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _Because as we perturb the sensors
column6: it'll collect the new data and _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: more useful data then we will obtain more data for prediction.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And this data generally will help us improve the predicting accuracy.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _And in this loop

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: humans will recognize what additional data will need to be collected.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _And machines

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: help humans identify what data should be collected next.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _In general
column6: we want to collect data that is most useful for learning. _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And there was actually a subarea in machine learning called active learning

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: that has to do with this.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: How do you identify data

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: points that would be most helpful in machine learning programs?

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _If you can label them

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _So

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: you can see there is a loop here from data acquisition to data analysis.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: Or data mining to prediction of values.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _And to take actions to change the word

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And then you can then decide what additional data

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: have to be collected by adjusting the sensors.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _Or from the prediction arrows
column6: you can also note what additional data _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: we need to acquire in order to improve the accuracy of prediction.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And this big picture is actually very general and

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: it's reflecting a lot of important applications of big data.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _So
column6: it's useful to keep that in mind while we are looking at some text _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: mining techniques.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: So from text mining perspective and we're interested in text based prediction.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _Of course
column6: sometimes texts alone can make predictions. _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And this is most useful for

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: prediction about human behavior or human preferences or opinions.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: But in general text data will be put together as non-text data.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _So the interesting questions here would be

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: how can we design effective predictors?

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And how do we generate such effective predictors from text?

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And this question has been addressed to some extent in some previous lectures

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: where we talked about what kind of features we can design for text data.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And it has also been addressed to some extent by

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: talking about the other knowledge that we can mine from text.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _So
column7: topic mining can be very useful to generate the patterns or topic _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: based indicators or predictors that can be further fed into a predictive model.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: So topics can be intermediate recognition of text.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: That would allow us to do design high level features or

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: predictors that are useful for prediction of some other variable.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _It may be also generated from original text data

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: implementation of the problem and it serves as more effective predictors.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _And similarly similar analysis can lead to such predictors

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _So

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: text mining algorithms can be used to generate predictors.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _The other question is
column6: how can we join the mine text and non-text data together? _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _Now
column6: this is a question that we have not addressed yet. _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _So

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _and in the following lectures
column6: we're going to address this problem. _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: Because this is where we can generate much more enriched features for prediction.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And allows us to review a lot of interesting knowledge about the world.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: These patterns that are generated from text and

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _non-text data themselves can sometimes

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _But
column6: when they are put together with many other predictors _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: they can really help improving the prediction.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _Basically
column6: you can see text-based prediction can actually serve as a unified _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: framework to combine many text mining and analysis techniques.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: Including topic mining and any content mining techniques or segment analysis.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: The goal here is mainly to evoke values of real-world variables.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: But in order to achieve the goal we can do some other preparations.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And these are subtasks.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _So one subtask could mine the content of text data

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And the other could be to mine knowledge about the observer.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _So sentiment analysis

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And both can help provide predictors for the prediction problem.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _And of course we can also add non-text data directly to the predicted model

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: then non-text data also helps provide a context for text analyst.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And that further improves the topic mining and the opinion analysis.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And such improvement often leads to more effective predictors for our problems.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: It would enlarge the space of patterns of opinions of topics that we can

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: mine from text and that we'll discuss more later.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: So the joint analysis of text and

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: non-text data can be actually understood from two perspectives.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _One perspective
column6: we have non-text can help with testimony. _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: Because non-text data can provide a context for

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: mining text data provide a way to partition data in different ways.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And this leads to a number of type of techniques for contextual types of mining.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And that's the mine text in the context defined by non-text data.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _And you see this reference here
column6: for a large body of work

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _And I will need to highlight some of them

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _Now
column6: the other perspective is text data _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: can help with non-text data mining as well.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And this is because text data can help interpret

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: patterns discovered from non-text data.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: Let's say you discover some frequent patterns from non-text data.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: Now we can use the text data associated with instances

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: where the pattern occurs as well as text data that is associated with

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: instances where the pattern doesn't look up.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And this gives us two sets of text data.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And then we can see what's the difference.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And this difference in text data is interpretable because text content is

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: easy to digest.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And that difference might suggest some meaning for

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: this pattern that we found from non-text data.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _So

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And this technique is called pattern annotation.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: And you can see this reference listed here for more detail.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: So here are the references that I just mentioned.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: The first is reference for pattern annotation.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: _The second is
column6: Qiaozhu Mei's dissertation on contextual text mining. _

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: It contains a large body of work on contextual text mining techniques.

name: 5 - 6 - 4.6 Text-Based Prediction (00-12-08).srt
text: [MUSIC]
